TopicTitle: WARNING MAY CONTAIN SOME MATHS! A tutorial on things I think are important in rocket building

Articles.Content:
A Tutorial showing what you need to know and how to go about building an efficient rocket in Kerbal Space program.

I show you some advanced information and also types of staging and also how to stage for a mission.

Warning this may contain maths, but you dont need to use it!

We go through: 

Atmospheric drag, 

Thrust to Weight ratio TWR

Delta V (change in velocity)

Advanced staging Asparagus staging etc..

How to stage a rocket for a mission

<iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/iS8ia9T5_UM?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>
I never thought about adding a fairing to an aerodynamic shaped pod. I'm going to experiment with that. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

> 
> I never thought about adding a fairing to an aerodynamic shaped pod.

My neither. I think it is counter intuitive, and probably is not realistic. That is to say: Squad needs to work a bit more on part drag.
